wikipedia_page.main: Angela Gilmour (née Piggford, born 17 August 1963) is a female English former track and field athlete who competed in the 400 metres and the 4 x 400 metres relay. In the relay, she represented Great Britain at the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, while at the Commonwealth Games, she won a silver medal in Edinburgh 1986 and a gold medal in Auckland 1990.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1988 Summer Olympics
response: * Linda Keough, Jennifer Stoute, Angela Piggford, and Sally Gunnell

In 1985, her 200 metres season's best was 22.87 for fifth in the European Cup, while in 1986, she failed to run below 23 seconds. She did still manage to win four medals at that years Commonwealth Games in Edinburgh. She won bronze in the 400 metres, behind Australia's Debbie Flintoff and Jillian Richardson of Canada, silver in the 200 metres, behind Canadian Angella Issajenko, gold in the 4 × 100 m relay, with Paula Dunn, Joan Baptiste and Heather Oakes and ended the games with a silver medal in the 4 × 400 metres relay, with Jane Parry, Linda Keough and Angela Piggford.

In 1985, Keough improved her PB to 52.49 at the European Cup in Moscow. This time ranked her second in the UK for that year, behind Kathy Cook. In 1986, she won a silver medal representing England at the Commonwealth Games in Edinburgh, in the 4x400 metres relay, along with Jane Parry, Angela Piggford and Cook.

In 1988, Keough emerged as the UK's top ranked female 400 m runner. In June, she won the UK National Championships title in 52.25, before improving her personal best to 51.65 in winning the AAA Championships title, earning Olympic selection. At the Seoul Games, she reached the quarter-finals of the 400 metres, running 51.91 and reached the final of the 4 × 400 m relay, where along with Jennifer Stoute, Angela Piggford and Sally Gunnell, she finished sixth.http://www.todor66.com/oli//1988/Athletics/Women_4x400m_Relay.html

Representing England at the 1990 Commonwealth Games in Auckland in January, Keough won two medals. In the 400 metres she won a silver medal in 51.63, behind Nigeria'a Fatima Yusuf and ahead of another Nigerian Charity Opara. In the 4x400 metres relay, she won a gold medal, along with Jennifer Stoute, Angela Piggford and Sally Gunnell.

link_mentions.page: 1986 European Athletics Indoor Championships – Women's 400 metres

response: Beckford finished third in the 400 metres at the 1990 UK Championships, and later earned relay selection for the European Championships in Split. The British quartet of Angela Piggford, Jenny Stoute, Beckford and Linda Keough ran 3:28.73 in the heats, to qualify for the final as the fifth fastest. With Sally Gunnell replacing Piggford, they broke the six-year-old British record with 3:24.78 in the final, to win the bronze medal, with Beckford running a 51.9 split.
Parry represented England in the 4 x 400 metres relay event with Kathy Smallwood-Cook, Linda Keough and Angela Piggford, at the 1986 Commonwealth Games in Edinburgh, Scotland.
